description: Occupying a corner plot on Bethnal Green Road, in a rapidly changing area of East London, the existing 1970s textiles workshop is a robust, yet unremarkable three-storey masonry building. The building has been extensively redeveloped and extended to provide new creative workspaces within a high-quality, low-energy and materially rich office building.

events.name: Building Tour of 469 Bethnal Green Road

factsheet.heading: Building tour of 469 Bethnal Green Road
paragraphs: Join Carmody Groarke for a building tour of 469 Bethnal Green Road, a recently completed redevelopment and extension of a former 1970s textile workshop in the heart of East London.
Led by Associate Director Lukas Barry, the tour will begin outside the building, setting the scene for the redevelopment within the context of the local area.

Once inside, Lukas will delve into the key design approaches to redevelop the building, turning an unremarkable three-story masonry structure into a high-quality, flexible workspace. He will highlight how the design leverages the buildingâ€™s existing spatial and material qualities, retaining the original masonry-clad steel frame and seamlessly integrating a new lightweight three-story extension. This extension, crafted from hot-dipped galvanised steel, adds a distinctive yet harmonious addition to the existing silver-grey brick base.

name: 469 Bethnal Green Road
